Description: Occurs when demand for goods and services exceeds supply, leading to higher prices.
Results from increased costs of production, such as rising wages and raw materials.
Linked to adaptive expectations, where workers demand higher wages, and businesses increase prices in anticipation of inflation.
Expansionary monetary policy, such as low interest rates and increased money supply, can lead to inflation.
Events like pandemics or geopolitical tensions can disrupt supply chains, leading to shortages and price increases.
